
## Descripción

In RSA d is a lot bigger than e, why don't we use d to encrypt instead of e? Connect with `nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566`.


## Solución

Inicio conectándome al puerto, donde obtengo los datos de c, n y e.
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ nc jupiter.challenges.picoctf.org 19566
c: 
n: 
e: 
```

De acuerdo a los datos que tengo y al documento RSA, calculo lo siguiente:
Declaro c, n y e:
```bash
┌──(kali㉿kali)-[~]
└─$ python3
Python 3.13.7 (main, Aug 20 2025, 22:17:40) [GCC 14.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> c = 264142342030372014726407194970160808832893512514542785218485720\
64523331667624307562083791833315112503092363330774631163245850709329754\
42268096035924823355734008045532153369451858969964058557544191504319840\
46807857917674945800009774149814446212367234279192824145062072670581521\
28304657792931750604263356712925
>>> 
>>> n = 126991259179810506483869174206345053780558137916729932224020729\
58905459730403014592990375186294094348677194415163765619492504766207827\
91142259822273421909601441532861559793887952857473496170652009291130895\
91326461347834428363941151762767560733137223084105494714326677395003561\
526799940974460022249951699407221
>>> 
>>> e = 65537
```

Usando la fórmula calculo m, sustituyo d por e:
Calculo e imprimo la bandera.
```bash
>>> m = pow(c, e, n)
>>> 
>>> flag = bytes.fromhex( hex(m)[2:]).decode()
>>> print(flag)
picoCTF{bad_1d3a5_2438125}
```
